Detailed Description

XmlNode is a class to encapsulate an XML tag and its content.

const char* XmlNode::getAttributeValueByName (  const char *  name  ) 
 

Get a copy of the value of an attribute specified by name

Parameters:
name contains the name of the attribute to get the value
Returns:
a copy of the attribute value.

XmlNode* XmlNode::getChildNodeByName (  const char *  name  ) 
 

Retrieve a reference on a child node whitch the name is equal toname. If several child nodes have the same name, a pointer on the first one in list is retrieved. If no child node named name exist, NULL is returned.

Parameters:
name contains the name of the child node to get.
Returns:
a pointer on an instance of XmlNode, or NULL if no child node match name
See also:
getNextChildNodeByName()

XmlNode* XmlNode::getFirstChildNode (  void   ) 
 

Retrieve a reference on the first child node in list (whatever its name) If node does not contain any child node, NULL is returned.

Returns:
a pointer on an instance of XmlNode, or NULL if node contains no child node
See also:
getNextChildNode()

const char* XmlNode::getName (  void   )  const
 

Retrieve a copy of the tag name

Returns:
a copy of the tag name.

XmlNode* XmlNode::getNextChildNode (  void   ) 
 

Retrieve a reference on the next child node is list getFirstChildNode() must be call at least once before

Returns:
a pointer on an instance of XmlNode, or NULL if node contains no more child node
See also:
getFirstChildNode()

XmlNode* XmlNode::getNextChildNodeByName (  void   ) 
 

Retrieved a reference on the next child node named name. getChildNodeByName() must be call with name as parameter at least once before.

Returns:
a pointer on an instance of XmlNode, or NULL if no more child node match name
See also:
getNextChildNodeByName()

const char* XmlNode::getSimpleContent (  void   )  const
 

Get a copy of the simple (e.g. the textual) content of the node. Ex: if the node is <node>this is <child_node>something</child_node> a simple content</node>, getSimpleContent() will return "this is a simple content"

Returns:
a copy of simple content of the node, or NULL if node do not have any simple content

void XmlNode::removeChildNodeByName (  const char *  name  ) 
 

Remove and destroy a the first child node in list named name`

Parameters:
name contains the name of the child node to remove and destroy

const char* XmlNode::serialize (  void   ) 
 

Get a textual representation of the node. Ex: <node param1="value1">blah blah<child_node>blah</child_node></node>

Returns:
a textual representation of the node

void XmlNode::setAttributeValueByName (  const char *  name,
const char *  value
) 
 

Set (or change, if already set) the value value of the attribute names name

Parameters:
name contains the name of the target attribute
value contains the value to set

void XmlNode::setSimpleContent (  const char *  content  ) 
 

Set a simple (e.g. a textual) content to the node. Ex: <tag>this is a simple content</tag>

Parameters:
content is a string containing a textual content
